results.name: Number of ones in binary representation of n^2.
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
Bernt Lindström, On the binary digits of a power, Journal of Number Theory, Volume 65, Issue 2, August 1997, Pages 321-324.
Nick MacKinnon, Problems and Solutions #12140, The American Mathematical Monthly, 126:9 (2019), 850.
K. B. Stolarsky, The binary digits of a power, Proc. Amer. Math. Soc. 71 (1978), 1-5.
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
formula: Lindström shows that lim sup wt(m^2)/log_2 m = 2. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Oct 11 2013
maple: A159918 := proc(n) return add(b, b=convert(n^2, base, 2)): end: seq(A159918(n), n=0..100); # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Jun 23 2011
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 25 2009
